comments:

Fix in hand, doing some more testing before delivery.  Had to do with the same
issue that was found with tests on Linux last week.

The fix I have is to remove the quotes completely from the %JAVA_PATH% insertion
in test.tools.core pluginconfig.xml (changed a few months back via one of
Samson's defects bugzilla_106568).  I'm not sure if this will break anything
else, I will re-assign to platform but first make the fix to i3 so z/OS test
execution will work. 

I will fix in the workaround and then test this fix on Windows and Linux to
ensure no other regressions.  It might be that this has to be fixed in
'launcher.c' by Samson/Hendra before we ship i3.  Samson knows more about what
was involved with the original change in bugzilla_106568.

Reassigning to Scott. If needing to fix in native code, please assign to 
Samson.

I tested the workaround of removing the "'s from %JAVA_PATH% use in the
test.tools.core pluginconfig.xml file in the RAC.  Test execution still works on
Windows XP, Linux and z/OS with the fix.

I believe the interesting experiment will be to run it where the JAVA_PATH
contains spaces and is not surrounded in quotes any more.

Samson, I believe the severity of this can be reduced to major from blocker
since we have a workaround.  We are also release noting the fact that if any
type of hang like this occurs the user can modify the pluginconfig and attempt
quoting the paths, etc.

I suggest this should be fixed in 4.1.  This affects windows os as well as 
others, and many JVMs install into a directory with spaces in the path by 
default.  (For example "C:\Program Files\Java\j2re1.4.2_08")  This problem is 
difficult to diagnose when it occurs, and should be trivial to fix.

One question, is this a regression from a previous RAC release on z/OS? I want
to isolate whether this is due to a recent change in the launcher code.

If the config change is the preferred way, I would suggest we change the z/OS
config only while keeping the quotes on other platforms.

If it turns out that we are going to fix the z/OS config file for this release,
what I suggest is to lower the severity and defer to 4.2 instead of closing this
bug as fixed since we just workaround the root problem.
Samson, I delivered the patch you sent me, this defect can now be resolved.
As per Scott's comment, the fix is committed.

Reopening the bug as Samson's earlier comment seem to indicate the severity 
should be lowered becuase a workaround was provided, not actual fix. Samson 
can dispose of it properly.

Sri. I think we can close it for now unless there is a request to support
space-separated directory names on the z/OS, which is very rare and may not even
be supported. The fix has been verified on the z/OS.
